com.rexsl.core

Class ExceptionTrap

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.rexsl.core.ExceptionTrap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig

    public final class ExceptionTrap
extends HttpServlet
    All uncaught exceptions will be caught here.

    Configure it in your WEB-INF/web.xml like this: 

     <servlet>
  <servlet-name>ExceptionTrap</servlet-name>
  <servlet-class>com.rexsl.trap.ExceptionTrap</servlet-class>
  <init-param>
   <param-name>template</param-name>
   <param-value>/com/example/Trap-Template.html</param-value>
  </init-param>
 </servlet>
 <servlet-mapping>
  <servlet-name>ExceptionTrap</servlet-name>
  <url-pattern>/trap</url-pattern>
 </servlet-mapping>
 <error-page>
  <exception-type>java.lang.Throwable</exception-type>
  <location>/trap</location>
 </error-page>

    The template of "service not available" web page is configured with the only one init-params. The template should be available in classpath as a plain text file (preferrably in HTML) and shall contain &#36;&#123;text&#125; text, which will be replaced with a full description of exception just thrown and caught.

    Since:
    0.4.2
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Yegor Bugayenko (yegor@tpc2.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    To do:
    #262 This class should be serializable, but it's not. It doesn't restore its state after deserialization. We should create a test for it and then fix the defect.
